entry.title: Maybe the real trophy is the lesbian moms we made along the way.
entry.summary:
Author: kaya48

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,627Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gay,‚Äù he says resolutely, leaving no space for discussion. Evidently, his mom didn‚Äôt get the memo. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to be!‚Äù Eddie can feel Buck tense up next to him. If he gave even the slightest indication, Buck would probably go fist-fight Helena Diaz right in this spot. Not that it wouldn‚Äôt be funny to watch his cute, golden retriever partner fight his conservative, son-stealing mom, but he decides that dropping a Buck-shaped bomb on them, quickly followed by a gay-colored second one, is enough massacre for one night. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs who I am, Mom. It‚Äôs not a choice, and it‚Äôs not going to change.‚Äù Hopefully, it sounds as decisive as he feels, no space for debate for real this time. So, turns out, his mom was still actively ignoring the memo. ‚ÄúYes, it is. I thought I was a lesbian once, and guess what, I chose not to be.‚Äù ¬† ¬† or: Eddie wants to give his parents a chance to do the right thing, so he decides to reintroduce them to Buck, as his boyfriend, and maybe come out whilst he's at it. It does not go as planned.

entry.title: And If I Drown, What Then?
entry.summary:
Author: Allypop_84

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,124Chapters: 4/12Kudos: 124

Summary: Post-lawsuit, Buck fights to reclaim his place at the 118. But the team he came back for doesn‚Äôt quite feel like home anymore, and the distance between him and Eddie keeps widening. Buck feels himself slowly disappearing - first from the team, then from himself. He's always been good at saving other people. He's never been good at saving himself. Or A Buck and Eddie post-lawsuit fic. ----------- Please heed the tags! This fic explores alcohol and substance abuse and may be triggering for some readers. If these themes are difficult for you, please put yourself first.

entry.title: Better The Devil You Know, Than The Devil You Don't...
entry.summary:
Author: InterrogateTheCat

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 60,897Chapters: 19/50Kudos: 678

Summary: Lucifer made a deal with the Buckley's, he will save Daniel and they take in and love his son Evan as their own. When the Buckley parents don't follow through with their side of the deal, Lucifer brings Evan with him to LA. This is the story of Evan Buckley the Son of the Devil, The Prince of Hell. Note:First 2 Chapters go through his life before the 118.Chapter 3 he is with the 118.Chapter 4 is when Eddie arrives. entry.title: A drop of golden sun
entry.summary:
Author: NickName95

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,363Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 28

Summary: An AU 9-1-1 and Percy Jackson universe mashup cause I like both series. Truthfully they just weren‚Äôt the religious sort. That is until their son Daniel is diagnosed with juvenile leukemia. ¬† It is then that the Buckley‚Äôs are more open to religion. More open to divine help. More open to anything that would help them keep their son alive. Apollo only meets with the Buckley‚Äôs a few times throughout Margaret‚Äôs pregnancy. He tells them that he can‚Äôt be too involved for godly reasons, and warns them that the child they now bear will be unlike their other two children. entry.title: My life, the war that never ends.
entry.summary:
Author: Buddiecanon_911

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,491Chapters: 6/8Kudos: 124

Summary: He was heading back to the loft after the first 12 hour shift of three in a row, opting for the stairs instead, needing the extra time to clear his head after another crappy day at work. He thought after three weeks the team would at least start to forgive him, but nobody had so much as looked his way for more than ten seconds before averting their eyes in disgust. As much as he wanted to call in sick, he thought he could hold on just a little longer, and if they still didn't forgive him, he could always just go back to active duty. He climbed the last flight of stairs and headed down the hallway toward his loft, he pulled his keys from his pocket and fumbled when they slipped from his grasp and clattered to the floor, the noise echoing through the silent hallway. He bent down to pick them up, only to get whacked in the back of the head as he rose, his face smashing against his door, leaving a small trail of blood from the impact as he passed out, feeling a small prick in his neck. OR Buck goes missing after the lawsuit, turns out he was a SEAL and his kidnapper fakes his suicide, but Eddie doesn't believe it.

entry.title: The World Is Brighter Than The Sun Now That You're Here
entry.summary:
Author: Maraudering_Paige

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,365Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 56

Summary: Of course Eddie would realise he was in labour whilst he was alone. Chris was at school. Buck was working his last shift before he would be going on paternity leave. Eddie was alone, and had probably been in labour for a while given the pain that had been radiating in his lower back for the past few hours. But now, now the contractions were in his stomach, too. Regular. Painful. And he was alone. Hunching over the bed, his hands gripping at the sheets as a contraction gripped at his womb, and trying to breathe through it....Eddie gives birth to his and Buck's baby girl. PregEddieWeek day 7: Birthdate. I hope you're having a good day! xx

entry.title: some things stay
entry.summary:
Author: literalmetaphor

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,755Chapters: 5/13Kudos: 84

Summary: ‚ÄúYou gotta be pretty desperate to take a job like this, especially with a kid.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy‚Äôs that?‚Äù Eddie‚Äôs face flickers through a dozen almost-expression, like hail against a window pane, never quite breaking through. Buck ticks the reason off on his fingers. ‚ÄúYou got a ghost story looming over everything. No civilization for miles. The place is old and dark and, well, let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîcreepy. The proprietor is an obvious drunk. That enough for you?‚Äù Eddie scoffs. ‚ÄúYou forgot to mention the incredibly off-putting gardener.‚Äù Buck definitely does not smile. ‚ÄúThat too.‚Äù Then, ‚ÄúSo, I figure there‚Äôs something equally wrong with you.‚Äù -- A loose Bly Manor AU.

entry.title: my skin got worse with good intentions
entry.summary:
Author: veil_nebula

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,521Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 47

Summary: What if Eddie had come in a minute later and the floor had collapsed on top of him? What if the debris had hit the railing differently and knocked into Eddie‚Äôs head instead? What if he hadn‚Äôt run into Buck in the stairs, had kept going, and fallen a floor down into fire and smoke and rebar looking for him? A hand clasps his shoulder, making him jump. ‚ÄúBuck,‚Äù Chim‚Äôs voice comes to his ears through cotton. His tone suggests it‚Äôs not the first time he‚Äôs said his name. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine,‚Äù he mumbles on autopilot, straightening up where he‚Äôd been coiling into himself without realizing. entry.title: Beetles and Elderflowers
entry.summary:
Author: lisaragorn

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 102,107Chapters: 13/30Kudos: 18

Summary: In a reckless act of impulse, Evan Buckley abandons his life in Pennsylvania to follow his sister and what he believes is the love of his life, Abby, to Los Angeles. Enrolling at UCLA, this irresponsible decision becomes the catalyst for an entirely new chapter, one that leads him to cross paths with the enigmatic Eddie Diaz, a young single father struggling to balance his personal life with parenthood. What begins as an unexpected friendship quickly becomes something far more complicated than either of them anticipated.
